summary: Expand Home page polish beyond icon/button tweaks: update Hero to a darker cinematic premium background with a soft black gradient overlay; refine navbar spacing/padding and add subtle shadow depth; enhance story card shadows and hover interactions; standardize button hover transitions and border radius; and adopt premium editorial font pairing (serif headings + sans-serif body) while maintaining the black luxury theme.
architectural_notes: Primary pages: Home, Stories (listing + detail), About, Contact
Design direction: light/clean theme; professional layout; subtle animations
Add new legal page route: Terms & Conditions (/terms).
Add authentication routes/pages: Signup and Login with redirect after success.
Add new legal page route: Privacy Policy (/privacy).

Homepage UI spec includes: sticky top navbar with center links (Home/Stories/Categories/About/Contact) and right-side search icon + Subscribe CTA; homepage sections: Luxury Hero, Featured Stories, Categories, About, Newsletter strip, Luxury Footer (with Privacy/Terms).
Homepage refinement: Featured Stories cards should be text-only (remove only thumbnail images; keep card layout/content otherwise unchanged).
Homepage CTA styling: “Read Stories” and “Read More” buttons use solid black background with white text for a clean black-and-white look.
Homepage refinement: “Explore by Category” sub-icons should be solid, clean, minimal, professional icons consistent with the black-and-white luxury theme; do not change layout—icon style only.

existing_features.title: Create a multi-page frontend with these routes and pages, all in English user-facing text: Home (/), Stories (/stories), Story Detail (/stories/:slug or :id), About (/about), and Contact (/contact). Use a shared site layout with a persistent header (logo + navigation) and footer across all pages.

Implement a cohesive professional light theme for stories.pk with strong typography, spacing, and subtle animations (e.g., hover/press states, soft section transitions). Choose a clean editorial style (avoid blue/purple as primary colors) and apply it consistently across all pages and components.

Home page: add a hero section with a short tagline/description for stories.pk, plus a Featured Stories preview section that links to the Stories page and individual Story Detail pages, and include a clear call-to-action area with buttons linking to Contact (and optionally a placeholder Subscribe action if no backend subscription exists).

Stories page: implement a grid/list of stories with a search input and at least one simple filter control (e.g., category/tags). Search/filter should update the visible list client-side and be usable on mobile.

Story Detail page: render a full story view (title, author/byline optional, date optional, body content) based on the selected story from the listing. Include a back link to Stories and ensure the page renders a helpful “Story not found” state for unknown slugs/ids.
About page: create a clean informational page describing the website/mission (and optionally a small “Creator/Team” section). Keep copy in English and match the site’s professional styling.

Contact page: display the provided contact details and include a contact form with fields for name, email, and message. On submit, store the message in the backend canister and show a success/error status in the UI.

Footer: add a site-wide footer including quick links to Home/Stories/About/Contact, a placeholder area for social media links (only if user provides URLs later; otherwise render the section as empty/hidden), and a copyright notice for stories.pk.

Seed initial story content for the Stories listing/detail experience (minimum 8 stories) using a simple static dataset in the frontend (title, slug/id, excerpt, category/tags, and body). Ensure search/filter operates on this dataset.

Add generated brand images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI: a simple wordmark logo for the header and a light editorial hero banner image for the Home hero section.
Add a new Terms & Conditions page route (e.g., /terms) and render the provided professional Terms & Conditions copy in a clean, readable layout with headings and numbered sections.
Add navigation entry points to the Terms & Conditions page from site navigation (header and footer), consistent with existing navigation styling.

Update the Home page hero/banner content to match the requested banner concept: headline text “Explore Amazing Stories Every Day”, a primary CTA button labeled “Read Stories” linking to the Stories page, and a light/clean background treatment with subtle abstract shapes or gradient.

Implement the optional featured-stories motion element on the Home banner: either a small animation or a lightweight carousel that previews 2–3 featured stories and allows navigation to their detail pages.
Add dedicated Signup and Login pages that use Internet Identity authentication and redirect the user to an appropriate page after successful authentication.

Add a new Privacy Policy page route at "/privacy" and render the provided "Privacy Policy – Stories.pk" copy in a clean, readable layout with headings and numbered sections (matching the overall styling used by the existing Terms page).
Add navigation entry points to the new Privacy Policy page from the site header navigation (desktop and mobile menus) and from the footer quick links, consistent with existing navigation styling.

Redesign only the Home page ("/" route) into a world-class, high-end, luxury-style layout while keeping all other pages unchanged. The Home page must include these sections in this order: (1) Premium Hero banner with headline “Where Stories Come to Life.”, subtext “Discover powerful narratives, timeless wisdom, and stories that inspire the world.”, and two CTAs: “Read Stories” (links to /stories) and “Explore Categories” (scrolls to the Categories section on the same page); (2) Featured Stories section with a 3-column grid on desktop; (3) Categories section with a clean icon + category name grid on a light background; (4) About promo section with an image and the provided mission copy and a “Learn More” button (links to /about); (5) Newsletter strip with a dark background and email field + “Subscribe” button (placeholder interaction, no backend). The visual style must feel premium/modern/elegant with a clean white base, black typography, subtle shadows, refined spacing, and a luxury accent color (Deep Blue / Royal Purple).

Implement premium card styling and micro-interactions on the Home page for the Featured Stories grid: each card must include a thumbnail image, story title, a 2-line preview, and a “Read More” button, with a soft shadow, rounded corners, and a hover animation (subtle lift + shadow). This design should be limited to the Home page (do not alter the existing Stories listing cards unless required for the Home page only).

Add or update the static Home page imagery so the hero and Home page sections look premium and storytelling-focused. Use generated static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and ensure the new images are referenced directly from the Home page (no backend image serving).

Update the Home page Featured Stories cards to remove only the story thumbnail images (do not remove any other card content or change layout/typography beyond what is necessary to account for the missing image). This should apply only to the Home page featured story cards and must not affect story cards used on other pages (e.g., the /stories listing).

Restyle the Home page hero primary CTA button labeled “Read Stories” to use a solid black background with white text (including appropriate hover/focus styles) while keeping the button size, placement, and behavior unchanged.

Restyle the Home page Featured Stories card CTA button labeled “Read More” to use a solid black background with white text (including appropriate hover/focus styles) while keeping the existing icon and navigation behavior unchanged.

Update the icon style used in the Home page “Explore by Category” section (rendered by `frontend/src/components/home/HomeCategoriesGrid.tsx`) so all category sub-icons look professional, solid/filled, clean, and minimal in an elegant black-and-white luxury theme, without changing the existing layout, spacing, category count/order, or text content.
Replace the Home page hero image with a darker, cinematic, premium-looking background and apply a soft black gradient overlay on top of the image to achieve a luxury/high-class feel.

Refine the site navbar styling by increasing horizontal spacing between desktop menu items, increasing header padding, and adding a subtle drop shadow under the sticky navbar for depth while preserving existing navigation structure and behavior (desktop + mobile).

Enhance story card styling across the app by applying a slightly stronger (but still soft) shadow and adding a smooth hover interaction (subtle lift or scale) to make cards feel modern and interactive, while maintaining readability and existing content/layout.

Upgrade button interactions site-wide by ensuring all buttons have smooth hover animations with a 0.3s transition, consistent border radius, and styling aligned with the black luxury theme (preserving existing button variants and behaviors).

Implement premium editorial font pairing by using a classy serif font for headings (e.g., Playfair Display or Cormorant) and a clean sans-serif font for body text (e.g., Inter or Poppins), and apply it consistently across all pages.
